text: Vinícius Figueira (born 15 April 1991) is a Brazilian karateka. In 2018, he won the silver medal in the men's kumite 67 kg event at the 2018 World Karate Championships held in Madrid, Spain. He is scheduled to represent Brazil at the 2020 Summer Olympics in karate. In 2014, he won one of the bronze medals in the men's kumite 67 kg event at the 2014 World Karate Championships held in Bremen, Germany. At the 2019 Pan American Games held in Lima, Peru, he won one of the bronze medals in the men's kumite 67 kg event. == Achievements == {| class="wikitable sortable" width=45% style="font-size:90%; text-align:center;" |- !Year !!Competition !!Venue !!Rank!!Event |- |2014 |World Championships |Bremen, Germany |bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd |Kumite 67 kg |- |2018 |World Championships |Madrid, Spain |bgcolor="silver" | 2nd |Kumite 67 kg |- |2019 |Pan American Games |Lima, Peru |bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd |Kumite 67 kg |} == References == Category:Living people Category:1991 births Category:Place of birth missing (living people) Category:Brazilian male karateka Category:Pan American Games medalists in karate Category:Pan American Games bronze medalists for Brazil Category:Karateka at the 2019 Pan American Games
title: Vinícius Figueira
